posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1318419
>how [I have literally no spare drives]
Boot to linux and
smartctl -a
badblocks -n
The "-n" is important, it tests every block on the device but first makes a copy of the data and puts it back afterwards. If the "reallocated sector count" is non-zero before you begin, or it increases because of the test, the device is toast. Whilst "-n" is supposedly "non-destructive", it can push a dodgy device over the cliff, and you might lose the specific sector it fails on if the device isn't writing reliably, so back up everything you care about first.
>how [I have spare drives]
dd onto a new/known-good device and see if the problem goes away

>>1318402
>here's the disk overview
That's clearly GPT, so your boot is clearly UEFI (as you do not have an MBR to boot). So >>1317949
>If I go to the BIOS and change it to Legacy, Windows will still go into black screen, however the recovery menu works in Legacy.
is a red herring, you should be set to UEFI with Secure Boot on and CSM off.
>>1318402
>I think the problem lies in the EFI boot pratrition.
Then erase everything on it and recreate it with bcdboot.

diskpart
select vol 7
format quick fs=fat32
assign letter=s:
exit
bcdboot c:\windows /s s:

Obviously checking the drive letters and volume numbers is your job, no complaining on 4chan.

posts.com:
You know those glossy, ultra-slick action movies from the mid-90s
to early 2000s where they didn't care for realistic physics or
whatever, they just wanted it to look awesome? Give me some
recommendations for those kind of movies.

Criteria - REQUIRED:
- kickass action that doesn't give two shits about being realistic
- Dark gritty cities
- Guns, LOTS of guns
- weapons that might be made of chrome
- really unique weapon, costume and set designs
- Secret organizations

NOT 100% Required
- Supernatural element and evil inhuman monsters, possibly with a conspiracy or mystery to solve
- good looking protagonist, possibly laden in something with leather
- May or may NOT have had Patrick Tatopoulos in production in some way or other
- heavy metal, hip-hop or techno soundtrack (DEFINITELY not required, but helps)
- Made before 2010 (NOT required, as several entries below will show you)

posts.name: ESSENTIALS
posts.com:
List so far

ESSENTIALS
1 - Alien series (protozoa for this kind of shit, as is the Terminator series...at least the first 3)
2 - Blade (THE codifier for everything on this series; same with the Matrix)
3 - Resident Evil film series, directed by Paul WS Anderson as well as
4 - Underworld film series
5 - Doom 2005 with The Rock and Karl Urban
6 - Ultraviolet by Kurt Wimmer with Milla Jovovich

posts.name: SUPPLEMENTARY MATERIAL
posts.com:
List so far

SUPPLEMENTARY MATERIAL

1 - Nemesis 1992 (remember when Selene in Underworld escaped the Lycans by blasting the floor into Swiss cheese? This film did it first. No joke, and it's AWESOME!)
2 - The Crow
3 - Uwe Boll's House of the Dead and Alone in the Dark (despite their reception they could when you actually watch them)
4 - Equilibrium (also directed by Kurt Wimmer)
5 - Priest 2011
6 - Hardcore Henry (minus horror element, fits the criteria above to a fucking T)
7 - I, Frankenstein (made by the guy who made Underworld and was SUPPOSED to have a crossover with it but, well, that fell through for one reason or another
8 - Hellboy and Hellboy 2: The Golden Army

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: tron

posts.name: POSSIBLY
posts.com:
List so far

POSSIBLY


1 - Van Helsing with Hugh Jackman
2 - League of Extraordinary Gentlemen with Sean Connery
3 - Aeon Flux with Charlize Theron (not sure about the cartoon)
4 - Event Horizon (also directed by Paul WS Anderson)
5 - Alien vs Predator series (also directed by Paul WS Anderson, though with the description I gave it might not be 100% correct)
6 - Queen of the Damned with Stuart Townsend and Aaliyah (very stylish but no cool gadgets)
7 - District 9 - What happens in the film is genuinely terrifying and the tech is cool, but doesn't have the color grading of what I mentioned...also none of them are found footage like District 9
8 - Legion (directed by the guy who made Priest, haven't watched it but seen some clips)
9 - Men in Black Series before International (scary shit in it, fits criteria mentioned above, but focuses more on Sci-Fi than horror honestly)
10 - Sam Raimi's Spider-Man films and Ben Affleck's Daredevil (the former has lots of cool high tech stuff, genuinely scary things, fitting for a horror director, while the latter has a hero clad in leather in a dark gritty city with a conspiracy/mystery solve, and both proudly say FUCK YOU to realistic physics or grounded action)

posts.com:
If there was bed bug poop you would see it alongside your bed frame and mattress, not just on the sheets. This is because bed bugs utilize what is know as a pro gamer move and live inside your mattress and bed frame where you can't kill them easily.

If you are still worried you might have bedbugs than for your piece of mind get a mattress cover and bug spray. Mattress covers are great because they trap the lil fuckers and starve them to death as well as stopping them from moving in. Warning though when you put it on don't take it off for like an entire year those fuckers can survive for an eternity. When applying the mattress cover pull the mattress completely off the bed frame and pull up blankets, sheets, pillows, and your personal laundry and put that through the wash. Since the mattress is off the frame take the opportunity to use the entire bottles worth spraying everything, and deep cleaning your room.

Decode this: ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK

A Twitter snowflake ID is a 64-bit binary number, with 41 bits representing a timestamp, 10 bits representing a machine ID, and 12 bits representing a per-machine sequence number. The snowflake ID is generally serialized in decimal format and is used in the post URL.

For example,
https://twitter.com/i/status/1581674019991916545
Decoding 1581674019991916545:
{'creation_time_milliseconds': 1665935447105,
'datacenter_id': 10,
'machine_id': 337,
'sequence_id': 1,
'server_id': 17}

The filename of a Twitter photo also contains a base64-encoded snowflake ID. This can be decoded into a regular snowflake ID, although it contains three "extra" unknown bytes.
For example,
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FdMR2WDaMAMPt2q?format=jpg
FdMR2WDaMAMPt2q -> 1572620320212922371

It is unknown if the filename of a Twitter video also contains a snowflake ID. You can see the URL contains it, but any off-platform video would would only contain the file name.
For example,
https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1564378065198882816/pu/vid/960x720/ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK.mp4

How would "ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK" be decoded into a snowflake, if it's possible?

Resources:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snowflake_ID
https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#snowflakes (good visualizations, twitter uses another epoch)
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xVrPoNutyqTdQ04DXBEZW4ZW4A5RAQW2he7qIpTmG-M/edit

real answers, you can tell if you

-google "does X site use DRM"

you should have just said what you wanted to do specifically from the start

easy, free, lower quality: you can use OBS if you disable hardware acceleration
easy, free trial, lossless: you can use anystream or a similar tool (do not install a virus pls)
easy, hardware cost, lower quality and requires encoding: you can use a chinese hdmi capture box that removes HDCP

other stuff is either cracking it yourself or buying widevine cracks, and using the typical tools the big boys use, which probably costs money for the crack, requires tech literacy and scripting

Thank you for trying my question. The goal is as few pixels and colors as possible. The reason is because of how fast Maid Space numbers get bigger. If you draw a maid, the Maid Address for her is somewhere between zero and the number of colors you used raised to a power equal to the number of pixels in the image, minus one. So counting can take a long time and make a huge book, or be beyond practical limitations of the computer.

Imagine you need four colors and drew the maid in a eight by six image. A radix four, eight by six Maid Space counts from zero to seventy-nine octillion two hundred twenty-eight septillion one hundred sixty-two sextillion five hundred fourteen quintillion two hundred sixty-four quadrillion three hundred thirty seven trillion five hundred ninety-three billion five hundred fourty-three million nine hundred fifty thousand three hundred thirty four.

Since /diy/ apparently became a full-time larping board, /wsr/ feels like a place where this might get an actual answer

Late for the show, but got to ask and this is going to be a stupid one.
The pin in a zipper of my jacket got accidentally bent and a tiny bit of the pin cracked and fell off. Along with it, the bottom slider (it's a two-sided zipper) also fell off (it can be easily put back with minimal tinkering). As a result, the zipper can't engage properly, because the hole in the pin prevents proper alignment of teeth. The hole is easily a 2x1x1 mm thing. The pin is made out of some plastic.
The jacket is off the warranty for 15 years, so bringing it back to store won't do anything for me (already asked, they've stopped doing the post-warranty repairs in 2018). I have now a choice to either replace the whole fucking zipper using off-brand zipper, which will cost me quarter of my monthly pay, or get a new jacket, which will cost me my quarterly earnings (assuming sales). Nothing else is wrong with the jacket, I'm having it since '02 and it's one of those "build to last" things (including having originally a 5 year long warranty, rather than regular 2) plus I'm really attached to the thing.

So my bright idea right now is to simply buy epoxy putty and fill the tiny crack, so it will get back the whole surface of the pin. However:
- is applying epoxy this small even going to hold?
- is epoxy going to hold for long, since the pin of a zipper is a part that gets constant friction
I almost never use the double-sided zipper itself, so I just zip it up, never unzip from the down direction, so technically speaking, the bottom slider can just rest forever, well, in the bottom

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1317652
That looks like nylon, so I would weld it:
- get some donor material that's exactly the same type of plastic (a no-name brand zipper, for example)
- get a cheap-ass temperature-controlled soldering iron off ebay. It has to be temperature controlled, that's the key to this operation
- set it to 300 degrees, and you should be able to push the plastic about like it's warm chocolate. Stir it all together so there's no gaps, build the hole up so there's excess plastic in every direction, then sand it back to the correct shape
If you want to definitely get nylon, you can get nylon washers.

Or bang a bit of superglue in there and shape it after it dries, or layer it until it fills the gap. Either way it looks pretty easy to solve, hopefully it lasts.

>It’s Fahrenheit.
No it's not, nylon melts at 500°F, so the idea that you could melt it at 300°F is ridiculous.

These $10 irons aren't particularly accurate, so load it up with the widest bit it comes with, start off at 250°C, and if no melty, turn it up to 300°C. Practice on something you don't care about first. Work at as low a temperature as possible, it's more important that you not burn it than you go fast.

>>1318051
If you get a shitty monitor you may have poor contrast (everything will look too bright or too dark, depending how you configure it).

This was THE SHIT when I was 13 but if you don't have the time to binge 10 to 20 episodes a day it will take you a long time to catch up and as you progress there is going to be unbearable amount of filer + cheap animation. I droped it after the time skip and picked it up later but personally it was a boring disappointing struggle to go through the arcs leading up to Dressrosa.

>is it really that good
Pre time skip One piece is fun and water 7 saga is a masterpiece and where the series peaked. There is still no manga/anime series that comes close to it's glory in being as long, detailed, imaginative with hundreds of characters and still going strong. I haven't watched it in years and don't know what is the current state but IMO if you liked it so far it's only going to get better.

Watch up to episode 130 where Arabasta arc apparently ends. If you liked it and want to see similar formula but 2x better continue watching and enjoy every second of it because around episode 523 you may just want to drop it or go to the manga. You may like it but I hate the time skip and think everything droped in quality from here in terms of new character designs and story.

To conclude it's a great show for young adults and I have a lot of nostalgia for the old One piece. Can't remember but I think over time it became less and less based and more liberal and gay as the show subtlety promoted race mixing, open borders and trannies started showing up but I never noticed watching it at the time.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1317385
So hear me out: Read the Manga, Google Search scenes that you like and see how the look animated. If you're curious about non Canon/Filler episodes, watch random ones. Filler is cute sometimes, unnecessary most though. And if you're really curious, watch some of the movies. But with time management, the manga is faster. I went from Volume 85(Chapter 849 - 858) to 98(Chapter 985-994) in 6 months. Yes I took breaks, I'm a college student and serve/work for a handful of places. but there was a period in those months where I was speed reading multiple volumes for a few weeks. You could go through 10 chapters in 40 minutes if you actually concentrate and embrace the story. Sorry for anyone who's low attention spanned or aDD/aDHD

Also, if you choose to read the manga, please read the recent color version releases. After 2005, the art style becomes looser and messier making sequences harder to process. I read the Viz Media translations cuz that's what I'm used to from childhood, but they don't have the color versions. For english sadly, there's only fan scanlations, so you'll have to deal with literal japanese hiragana usage and "UGUH SUGOI NAMI-KYUN XD" stupid choices. I'm sure if you ask OP fans on >>>/a/, they'll link you to a good fan translation.
